title: Data Driven Transformation of Global Pro Services Co
description:
A global leader in technology talent services is undergoing a transformation in which it needs to transform its data infrastructure, systems, and operations to be more strategically aligned to customers. Think of the shift from being a reactive vendor who services talent needs to a proactive market-maker who seeks out its most strategic partners. 

They are seeking an experienced data strategist and architect to support a ~3 month engagement focused on data discovery across ~100K job requisitions and 1 million+ talent profiles and helping to devise a "talent exchange" that provides dynamic data for leaders to steer the business. 


Conduct data discovery and cleaning to classify both talent and demand at scale.
Help design and validate a standardized scoring rubric to evaluate opportunities based on multiple factors.
Define a common data language that enables clearer understanding of workforce supply/demand dynamics.
Support the development of a data-driven recommendation engine that pulls live information (e.g., via Salesforce CRM).
Confirm and refine the current draft architecture (already ~85% complete) and advise on polishing it into a scalable, always-on system.

Data Discovery & Cleaning: Assess existing job and talent data, identify leakage, and prepare it for AI-driven classification.
Architecture & Rules Development: Build frameworks to classify demand and talent, set scoring rules, and define data inputs/outputs.
Recommendation Engine Validation: Vet the design of the recommendation system, including its data architecture and specificity requirements.

Deep experience ins.
Skilled at identifying relationships between complex datasets 
Strong familiarity with BI and visualization tools (Looker preferred; Tableau/Power BI also relevant).
Comfortable with Salesforce data integrations.
Background in consulting or advanced data strategy roles preferred (prior MBB experience preferred, though not required).
Advanced beyond spreadsheet-level analysis; has handled large-scale, high-complexity datasets.

Start date: ASAP
Duration: Approx. 3 months (potential for extension).
Structure: Deliverable-based / fixed cost (not hourly)
Remote role

title: Strategic IT Integration Lead: Global vs. Regional Operating Model (International Sportswear Retail)
description:
Project Overview:
We are seeking an expert IT M&A Strategy Consultant to lead the development of a technology integration framework following a high-profile, of a major US-based athletic footwear and fashion retailer by a leading .
The goal of this engagement is to define a clear . You will determine which parts of the technology stack should be centralized under the global parent’s infrastructure (e.g., Global Order Management, ERP) and which should remain regional or entity-specific to maintain the US brand's "best-in-class" local performance. You will serve as a strategic advisor to the , providing the framework and "hand-holding" necessary to navigate this transatlantic integration.


Develop the decision-making matrix to categorize IT services and systems into Global, Regional, or Local "buckets."
Evaluate the newly acquired US entity’s "best-in-class" e-commerce and omnichannel platforms against the global parent’s existing ecosystem to identify synergies, redundancies, or retention needs.
Create a roadmap for aligning US technical operations with the parent company's global standards without disrupting the brand's local market advantage.
Bridge communications between the UK corporate headquarters and the US-based leadership team to ensure technical alignment and cultural buy-in.

Deep experience in high-volume retail, specifically in the sectors, where omnichannel and inventory velocity are critical.
Proven track record of leading IT integrations for large-scale acquisitions (ideally involving UK and US entities).
Skilled in design and application rationalization.
Experience advising C-suite leaders (CTOs/CIOs) through complex, urgent transformations.

title: Public Relations Consultant for Sustainable Infrastructure Company
description:
Overview:
We're a global leader in sustainable infrastructure that is looking for a strategic PR consultant to lead the strategic communications for a major acquisition. 

We need a though partner who understands the nuances of the Digital Out-of-Home (DOOH) and Ad-Tech landscape to position our newly expanded network as the most innovated, data-driven player in North America.


Ad-Tech Specialist: Deep experience in digital advertising, DOOH, or media technology.
Media Access: Existing, active relationships with editors at Adweek, AdAge, The Drum, Digiday, and other tier-one trades.
Proven Results: A track record of securing earned media for brands in the advertising space within the last 12 months.
Strategic Vision: Ability to act as a consultant—not just a publicist—to craft a "Phase 2" narrative that positions the brand as a data-driven innovator.

title: Director, Digital Marketing & Integration Leader
description:
Overview:
We are seeking a strategic and results-driven Sr. Principal of Digital Marketing & Integration Leade to lead the integration and harmonization of our digital marketing practices across the enterprise. This role is pivotal in shaping our overall digital presence, driving customer engagement, and ensuring a seamless brand and operational integration across diverse platforms, teams, and processes.

The Digital Marketing and Integration Leader will be responsible for helping to shape the future of the digital experience for our global organization. They will be tasked with analyzing, planning, and executing on high-impact, cross-functional initiatives that will transform our primary web properties and other key digital touchpoints.
The ideal candidate will be someone who thrives in ambiguity and possesses the high-level expertise required to operate independently within a complex corporate environment.


Develop and execute a comprehensive digital marketing integration strategy aligned with business goals and customer needs.
Lead digital campaigns integration across web, email, SEO/SEM, social media, and paid media to drive awareness, engagement, and conversion.
Collaborate with product marketing, sales, and scientific teams to ensure consistent messaging and positioning.
Manage initiative level digital marketing budget and agency/vendor relationships.
Serve as the marketing lead for the integration of two companies, ensuring alignment of digital assets, brand identity, and customer experience.
Develop and manage integration plans for digital platforms, including websites, CRM systems, marketing automation, and analytics tools.
Partner with cross-functional teams (IT, HR, Sales, Legal, etc.) to ensure smooth operational and cultural integration.
Lead change management and communication strategies to support internal and external stakeholders.
Build and mentor a high-performing digital marketing team.
Set clear goals, KPIs, and performance metrics for team members and campaigns.

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
10+ years of experience in digital marketing, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
Proven experience in managing digital transformation or integration projects, ideally in the life sciences or healthcare industry.
Strong understanding of digital marketing tools, platforms, and analytics.
Excellent leadership, communication, and project management skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with multiple stakeholders.

title: Sr. Consultant for Diligence in Towers and Wireless Industry
description:
**In your pitch** Please copy and paste the Ideal Candidate bullets to respond with your specific experiences, providing specific examples of previous diligence you have worked on

We are a consulting firm that is looking for a senior consultant to assist our team on a Towers and Wireless diligence projects. Prior experience with market overview, market analysis, business plan assessment, market forecasts. Strong excel and communication skills desired.

This specific project will last 4 weeks and will start as soon as possible.

While this is one project, we typically have multiple similar diligence engagements that we are also looking for Data Center, Fiber, Towers, and general TMT experience.


Former Management Consultant with Diligence experience
Experience with TMT Industry
Experience with Towers and/or Wireless

title: Engineered wire harness data center product strategy
description:
A custom fabricator of wire harness assemblies is looking to break into the data center market through the electrical contractor channel.  They would like to collect intelligence on the appropriate product suite (e.g., common configurations) to offer to customers and then would like technical guidance as they build an online configuration tool into their website and sales materials

Domain knowledge of data center configurations and powering assemblies (e.g., Powerwhips, PDU cables) and the components that go into them is important for this role

title: Competitive War Gaming & Commercial Strategy: Global Renal Denervation (RDN) Market
description:
Industry: Medical Technology / Medical Devices

Corporate Strategy / Market Intelligence

A leading global medical technology company is seeking a strategic consultant to facilitate a "War Gaming" exercise for its Renal Denervation (RDN) portfolio. While the client is currently the global market leader in this space, new market entrants and evolving clinical landscapes necessitate a proactive assessment of competitive threats in the US and key international markets.

The client currently holds a leadership position in revenue and brand perception across 80+ countries. However, the market is approaching a pivot point due to new reimbursement approvals and upcoming US entries from major competitors. Competitive pressure is specifically intensifying around technical modalities, procedure efficiency, and depth of ablation.

The client is looking for a vendor with specific experience facilitating cross-functional "war gaming" exercises. The goal is to:


Assess the evolving competitive landscape across the US, Western Europe, China, and Japan.

Simulate competitor movements and pressure-test current commercial strategies.

Align internal cross-functional stakeholders on a comprehensive response to market challenges.


A PowerPoint summary capturing the outputs of the group exercises.

A compiled list of actionable recommendations and commercial strategies based on the workshop findings.

Timeline & Logistics

Target kickoff in February

Remote with a global view preferred (US, Western Europe, China, and Japan).

title: Technology Transformation Program Manager for PE-backed SaaS company
description: ***NOTE TO CANDIDATES: As part of your pitch, please copy/paste the “Ideal Candidate” bullets and briefly reply with your relevant qualifications for each one.

title: Senior Financial Modeling Expert (Excel Research Lab - Remote)
description:
Problem Statement:
We are an AI for Excel research lab, currently operating in stealth mode, with a focus on enhancing the capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) in complex financial modeling. A pivotal aspect of our project is acquiring high-quality, professional-grade financial modeling data. While we've utilized various freelance platforms, we've found a need for a higher level of talent to maintain data input quality that matches premier institutional standards.


The objective is to have experts develop superior, technically robust financial models that will serve as essential data for LLM training. The project's success will be gauged by the precision and accuracy of the Excel models and the consultants' proficiency in navigating complex financial scenarios without compromising quality.


- **Model Creation**: Develop comprehensive, professional-standard financial models within Excel.
- **Quality Assurance**: Ensure that all models are logically coherent and "auditor-ready" for research objectives.
- **Output-Based Delivery**: Begin with an hourly engagement model, with a transition towards an output/deliverable-based payment model for consistent, high-performing experts.


We seek individuals with exceptional qualifications, characterized by the following:
- **Investment Banking Experience**: At least 2 years within an Investment Banking firm.
- **Private Equity Experience**: An additional 1–2 years of experience within Private Equity.
- **Excel Proficiency**: Must have extensive, recent experience in financial modeling and be considered an "Excel beast."
- **Alternative Backgrounds**: Open to senior experts (20+ years) who have maintained hands-on financial modeling expertise throughout their careers.
- Note: General FP&A experience does not typically meet the specific technical modeling requirements we seek.


- **Duration**: Immediate start, with the budget expanding to support a significant scale-up in hiring.
- **Volume**: Anticipating onboarding 10 to 30+ individuals as the project scales.
- **Location**: 100% Remote; our focus is on North American financial professionals, though we welcome exceptional global talent (EMEA/APAC).

title: Portfolio Reputation Monitoring & Strategy
description:
A large cap PE firm is seeking a consultant or small team to develop a scalable solution for internal reputation management and online monitoring across its portfolio. While the firm has PR resources, they currently lack a centralized way to monitor the portfolio at scale and identify where to focus intervention efforts. 


 Establish a system to monitor online reviews, comments (e.g., Reddit, Google), and general sentiment across multiple portfolio companies simultaneously.
 Move beyond basic "data scraping" to provide competitive benchmarking—analyzing how portfolio companies stack up against competitors in the digital landscape.
 Identify and prioritize "red flag" reputational issues that could potentially "tank a sale" or decrease valuation during a divestiture process.
 Provide a clear framework for the firm to know exactly which portfolio companies require reputation support and when.

 Proven experience managing online reviews and brand sentiment at scale (not just at a single-company level).
 Ability to translate raw data into strategic insights for PE operating partners (the "where to focus").
 Knowledge of sentiment analysis and monitoring tools, but with a focus on high-level strategy rather than just technical development.


When submitting a pitch, please include any relevant case studies in Private Equity environments.

title: Former Operator for Warehouse Operations & Embellishment Assessment
description:
***NOTE TO CANDIDATES: As part of your pitch, please copy/paste the “Ideal Candidate” bullets and briefly reply with your relevant qualifications for each one.

We're a privately held Professional Services & Distribution company, currently generating $60M in annual revenue and specializing in uniforms and promotional products. Following a leadership transition and a period of significant growth, we are looking to scale our operational infrastructure.

We have recently purchased a 100,000 sq. ft. warehouse in Ohio and are preparing for a critical move and consolidation in March. As we transition away from leased space and upgrade our Warehouse Management System (WMS), we have identified a need for a professional, third-party assessment of our current operational processes. We are currently relying heavily on internal legacy reporting and seek a "True North" perspective on what "great" looks like for a mid-market distribution and services organization of our complexity.

The primary objective of this engagement is to perform a 360-degree audit of our Ohio operations—specifically focusing on team dynamics, throughput optimization, technology utilization, and the integration of our "embellishment" (embroidery/customization) services—to ensure we are optimized for headcount costs and scalability.


Conduct a 3–4 day deep-dive assessment at our Ohio warehouse, interviewing the Director of Operations and auditing functional teams (Shipping, Picking, Packing, and Embellishment).
Analyze current workflows, throughput metrics, and reporting structures to identify bottlenecks and areas where legacy processes are failing to meet current complexity.
Evaluate how current tools and the impending WMS upgrade are being utilized to optimize headcount and operational efficiency.
Assess the specialized embroidery/customization function within the warehouse to ensure it is seamlessly integrated with standard receiving and fulfillment operations.
Provide a comprehensive recap that validates current effective practices and identifies specific "blind spots" or areas for improvement.
Develop a "True North" proposal outlining the necessary steps for operational excellence as we move into the new facility in March/April.
Facilitate feedback sessions with the SVP & GM, VP of Operations, and HR leadership to align on findings and organizational health.

You have a "been there, done that" background, specifically having managed or led warehouse operations in a mid-market distribution environment.
Proven experience with distribution organizations that include a "services" or "customization" component (e.g., embroidery, embellishments, or light manufacturing).
Understanding of the tools and processes appropriate for a $50M–$200M company.
Experience evaluating or implementing Warehouse Management Systems to drive headcount optimization and data-driven decision-making.
Ability to quickly assess team dynamics and operational health through on-site interviews and observational analysis.
Ability to translate complex operational findings into a clear, high-level strategic roadmap for executive leadership.

title: Cybersecurity Framework Mapping & Gap Analysis (AICPA Membership Required)
description:
Project Overview
We are seeking a consultant with an active AICPA membership to perform a comparative analysis and control mapping across several major cybersecurity frameworks. This project requires someone who has performed cybersecurity audits in the past and can provide firsthand context on the level of effort and "test time" associated with various controls.


Framework Analysis: Summarize the specific controls and processes required to achieve SOC 2, ISO 27001, FedRAMP, and PCI DSS v4.01.
Overlap Mapping: Identify duplicative controls across these frameworks to determine where work in one area satisfies requirements in another.
Data Access: Utilize AICPA membership to access specific mapping tools and datasets currently behind paywalls that the client cannot access internally.
Operational Context: Beyond a paper mapping, provide insights into the practical "audit" experience—specifically how long these tests typically take to perform and how cybersecurity stacks are reviewed in practice.

Credentials: Active AICPA member (required) with prior experience certifying clients or performing audits against the listed frameworks.
Technical Knowledge: Strong understanding of cybersecurity stacks and control environments.
Level of Effort: This is estimated to be a quick-turnaround engagement (2–3 days of work) and is suitable for a junior-to-mid-level associate, provided they have the necessary membership and audit experience.

Timing: ASAP start with a 2–3 day turnaround.

title: Voice of Customer (VOC) Process Review & Strategy
description:
Overview:
A global electronics manufacturer is looking for a consultant to review and enhance its Voice of Customer (VOC) processes as the company undergoes a major transition and integration. The goal is to ensure robust, scalable methods for gathering, analyzing, and acting on customer feedback across products, processes, and services.
Historically, VOC efforts included an annual Net Promoter Score (NPS) survey, a targeted customer service survey (administered by a third party and focused on purchasing teams), and a real-time “happy faces” feedback tool. While current indicators show high satisfaction levels, engagement is limited to a small subset of customers, creating a need for more comprehensive, representative input.
We'd like a holistic view/approach for this project, so we envision dividing it into 2 phases:
 Assess the current VOC state, identify gaps, share best practices, and develop a future-state strategy and implementation plan.
 Support the execution of the recommended approach, ensuring processes are effective and scalable globally.


Industrial/B2B experience, ideally in the electronics or materials industry.
Strong understanding of industry standards and best practices when it comes to NPS, customer service, VOC surveys, etc.
Proven experience designing and implementing VOC programs globally.
Based in North America, some travel to the Philadelphia are may be required.


Relevant experience in VOC process design, implementation, and optimization.
Experience within the electronics or electronic manufacturing sector.
Global experience.

title: PMO Diagnostic & Standardization/Training
description:
We are a PE-backed Industrial Automation and Systems Integration company that provides full-stack automation capabilities—from the physical layer (robotics, vision, and electrical installation) through PLC controls, SCADA, and MES—serving customers across Life Sciences, Food & Beverage, CPG, Chemicals, and other discrete and process industries.

We have been growing rapidly through add-on acquisitions. In the last year we've acquired 4 new businesses that are now operating as BU under our corporate platform. 

In each of these BUs there is a variance of project management maturity and capabilities, and we're now at the size and growth rate that we would like to formalize a PMO and bring the various PMs across these BU to a level of standardization and competency. 

We're looking for a consultant that has had extensive experience setting up and managing PMOs in a project-based industry. Because our companies are working on complex project, there's an added layer of complexity to setting up and establishing best practices for the function. 

Key Responsibilities/Goals of the Engagement: Current state maturity diagnostic (by BU and at platform level) across people, process, systems.
Standardized project language, key definitions, and core lifecycle (opportunity → URS /estimate → proposal / contract → hand‑off → execution → change control → EAC / financials → close‑out / lessons learned).
Recommended future-state roles/org, processes, and tool stack (incl. what is BU-specific vs. shared vs. platform-level).
Phased implementation roadmap and resource plan.

title: Patient Engagement Platform Advisory Support
description:
Our client is a leading patient engagement platform that facilitates high-volume online bookings, virtual visits, and digital patient check-ins. As they enter a new phase of growth, they are seeking a Senior Advisor to support the leadership team in evolving their commercial model, and launching a new product line. 

This is a (3-month minimum) intended for a subject matter expert who has successfully navigated the transition from a specialized healthcare tool to a broader, diversified marketplace or platform. The advisor will serve as a strategic partner to leadership, ensuring that the new product and commercial direction are grounded in proven industry playbooks.


The ideal candidate is a specialist with firsthand experience at a high-growth healthcare marketplace during a pivotal shift in their business model.


Experience Bonus: Strong preference for candidates who were present during Zocdoc's specific period of commercial model evolution (e.g., the shift to sponsored listings or paid discovery). 
Functional Expertise: A proven track record in GTM, Operations, Commercial Strategy, or Sales Leadership.
Strategic Advisory: The ability to offer "been-there-done-that" insights into the operational challenges of scaling a healthcare-specific marketplace product.

3-month minimum commitment.
Semi-permanent advisory role.
Scope, time commitment, and specific deliverables will be defined based on the consultant’s unique skillset and seniority.

title: Pricing Strategy for PE-Backed Aerospace Company
description:
We are a PE firm with a portfolio company in the aerospace industry. This company sells and operationalizes engine upgrades, but also does upgrades, maintenance, and repairs for turbo prop single and multi engine planes. We are looking for a consultant to help us understand the pricing strategy around the alternatives on these engine upgrades and refurbishments, ultimately helping us improve our margins. 

This consultant would have direct experience working with pricing strategy in the Aerospace industry, whether that was working at a firm or as a pricing operator at a large Aerospace company (United Technologies, Honeywell, etc.). They will need domain expertise related to engines and engine components. 

This project will be a 4-6 week diagnostic with the potential to extend beyond to support the implementation phase. We are looking to kick off the project as soon as we identify the right consultant.

title: Operating Model & Margin Optimization (B2B Tech-Enabled Services)
description:
We are a PE firm that invests into lower-middle-market B2B SaaS companies. Our portfolio company provides learning and compliance management software for accounting firms. The L&D segment of the business operates on a "subscription access to expertise" model, where their large enterprise clients receive high-end expertise and staff augmentation and “L&D in a box” solution for smaller firms. The current operating model is immature, so the goal is to stabilize a disciplined operating model that optimizes internal capacity and maximizes gross margin as the business scales.

The consultant will conduct a deep-dive diagnostic of the internal workings of the service delivery model. This is not a vendor spend rationalization or a pure pricing exercise; rather, it is an operational assessment focused on how the team delivers value to increase gross margins.

We are looking to kick this work off as soon as possible with a critical checkpoint in mid-to-late February/March. The final, detailed roadmap and implementation plan are expected by the April/May timeframe.


Analyzing current state gross margin by customer and identifying specific levers for improvement.
Evaluating team utilization and identifying opportunities to leverage lower-cost resources for specific activities.
Refining the organizational structure and standardized operating rhythms to support an expertise augmentation managed services model.
: Delivering a detailed plan to capture margin points through better resource leveling and process efficiency.


Former COO, VP of Ops, or CFO for Services Businesses
Experience with Organizational Design 
Cost Optimization through internal process design, resource allocation, and organizational scaling

title: Brand Licensing Consultant (NFL)
description:
We are a PE-backed consumer goods business that recently had a very successful year after gaining licensing rights for NCAA teams on our products. Based on this success, we're hoping to break into the NFL brand licensing space as well. 

We're looking for someone that has experience and can help our team get the right approvals and negotiate with the NFL brand licensing.

title: Marketing Operations & Tactical Execution Lead
description:
We are seeking a highly organized, tactically-focused Marketing Operations Consultant to provide execution-level support across a portfolio of pharmaceutical assets.

The buyer oversees a team of 8 Directors who are currently over-leveraged with "manager-level" administrative tasks. The goal of this engagement is to offload the "blocking and tackling" of marketing operations, allowing the senior leadership team to refocus on high-level brand strategy.
The ideal candidate is not a strategist, but a  who thrives in project management, budget tracking, and navigating complex internal systems.

Key Responsibilities
The consultant will support the team across three primary "buckets":

1. 
End-to-end management of marketing POs.
Rigorous budget tracking and consistent follow-up to ensure financial accuracy across multiple products.

2. 
Managing the upload and maintenance of marketing resources within a new Resource Management Portal.
Handling administrative workflows within  and SharePoint to ensure field teams have access to the latest approved materials.

3. 
Executing administrative requirements for Non-Personal Promotion (NPP) tactics (e.g., email blasts, GPO programs, speaker programs, and ad boards).
Managing vendor coordination, speaker logistics, and paperwork to ensure timelines are met and tactics actually deploy.

Required Experience & Profile
•  This is NOT a strategic role. We are looking for a candidate who is "hands-on" and comfortable with high-volume administrative execution.
•  Prior experience with any of the below systems is a significant advantage. Specifically:



•  Must understand the regulatory and compliance landscape of pharmaceutical marketing.
•  Exceptional project management, time management, and budget oversight.
•  Manager/Senior Manager level experience (or an independent consultant who specializes in "tactical" rather than "advisory" work).

title: Media Optimization Support for Pharmaceutical Company
description:
The Media Measurement Optimization & Web Analytics team within a large pharmaceutical organization is looking to backfill a manager level resource while a team member is out on leave for at at least 3 months. This resource would be focusing on translating complex media and site analytics into actionable insights to improve marketing ROI across the company's Primary Care and Oncology brands. The consultant will work closely with internal teams and media agencies (paid media) to implement the new measurement framework, optimize cross-channel strategies, and support data-driven decision-making.

This individual should be comfortable taking on Omni channel and HCP Media focused initiatives.

title: Salesforce Architect Lead Developer for a PE-Backed B2B Services Company
description:
We are a ~400m PE-backed full-service amenities service provider specializing in multifamily housing. The company performs several recurring services on a long-term contract basis. For context, we've seen consistent growth in our first 15 years, where we were operating in an entrepreneurial manner and growing rapidly while operating heavily on tribal knowledge. We have been going through an end-to-end alignment initiative of reconfiguring and redefining our end to end process (for example aligning what we sell with what we put into contract with what we deliver and what we bill). 

We are now working on operationalizing these changes in Salesforce. We have internal Salesforce admins, developers and an integration team, that is stretched for bandwidth so we're looking for a Salesforce architect lead developer to support our team. 

We need this person to support on the following activities:
Look at how we manage products and pricing and advise on how to implement this in SFDC
Support SFDC integration with embedded lifecycle management tools (Conga)
Support mobilization efforts to make it easily accessible for clients / users
Qualifications:
Salesforce experience in B2B services space
Can support on Salesforce strategy and implementation
Salesforce integration with contract lifecycle management tools
Change management experience

title: Salesforce dashboard builder / analytics support for PE-backed company
description:
Project description:

***NOTE TO CANDIDATES: As part of your pitch, please copy/paste the “Ideal Candidate” bullets and briefly reply with your relevant qualifications for each one. A PE-backed company is seeking a salesforce dashboard building / analytics support. The Consultant would be working directly with the finance team, including the Director of FP&A and Chief Revenue Officer to build monthly reports



Deep experience building reports and dashboards in salesforce - they need to be able to hit the ground running
Experience in building data visualizations in Salesforce and Tableau
Experience working with FP&A teams is a plus

title: Liquid Cooling Market Analysis
description:
Problem Statement:
Our organization is seeking a more detailed understanding of the liquid cooling equipment market, comprising critical components such as Coolant Distribution Units (CDUs), racks, manifolds, and cold plates. The detail we're seeking needs to be highly granular and specific, as we already have a broader understanding of these dynamics.


Success for this project will be a comprehensive understanding of the liquid cooling equipment market landscape. This includes detailed insights into original equipment manufacturers (OEMs), current market volumes, existing install bases, and future projections categorized by size and quantity. Armed with this information, our organization will be equipped to strategically plan and position ourselves in the market effectively.


The project scope includes an in-depth market analysis of the liquid cooling equipment sector, specifically focusing on CDUs, racks, manifolds, and cold plates. Deliverables will include a detailed report containing:

- A list of key OEMs and their market shares.
- Current market volumes and the existing install base.
- Projections of market growth by size and quantity for the next 5 years.
- Competitive landscape analysis, highlighting major competitors and market dynamics.


The ideal consultant will possess extensive experience in the data center or IT infrastructure industries, specifically within cooling technologies. Familiarity with mechanical or thermal engineering concepts related to liquid cooling systems is preferred. Additionally, proven capabilities in developing market forecasts and competitive analysis are essential.

title: Former CRO for PE-Backed Software Company
description:
We are a consulting firm working on an active operational transformation engagement at a PE-backed software company (~1B in revenue). We have built trust with this client through our active engagement and have identified a growth opportunity on the commercial side. We are trying to upsell our client on this opportunity and are looking for support in that.

We are looking for someone with the following criteria to help sell this opportunity to the current CRO.
Has held a CRO role (or has deep sales operations experience) at a software company in the 0.5 - 3B in revenue range
Experience selling
Has significant accountability for sales growth
Consulting experience
Strong EQ
If we win the work, this consultant will be brought on to support the execution. 
We see this type of opportunity across our clients so there is also appetite for this person to play a similar role with our other clients.

title: Consultant to support with Power BI reporting and dashboard development
description:
We are a PE-backed healthcare company looking to bring in support on reporting and dashboard development, with a focus on Power BI and our data stack.
Ideal candidate:

Strong Power BI experience (building executive friendly dashboards, measures, and data models)
Strong Snowflake experience (data modeling and working with warehouse based reporting pipelines)
Ideally, familiarity with Athena and healthcare data is a plus
Bonus if the person can also help think through integrating additional source systems beyond Athena over time (for example payroll and other sub ledgers)

title: Salesforce Marketing Cloud Strategy & Technical Product Manager (Wealth Management)
description:
As part of your pitch, please copy/paste the “Ideal Candidate” bullets for the role that is a fit and briefly reply with your relevant qualifications for each one.

A PE-backed wealth management firm is seeking a senior-level consultant to serve as the strategic bridge between business leadership and technical execution for a large-scale Salesforce Marketing Cloud deployment. Following a rollout to ~950 independent advisors, the firm needs a specialist who can translate high-level marketing goals into technical roadmaps while providing credible strategic guidance to executive stakeholders.


 Serve as a subject matter expert to the SVP of Marketing, advising on the effective use of Marketing Cloud to achieve growth, advisor recruitment, and adoption goals.
 Lead the "Business-to-Tech" briefing process, translating "fuzzy" & unformed business needs into concrete technical requirements, data segmentation logic, and journey entry/exit criteria for the development team.
 Design a comprehensive Marketing Cloud strategy and roadmap, identifying high-impact use cases and establishing repeatable templates for future journeys.
 Provide direction to junior technical resources responsible for "hands-on-keyboard" journey building; this role focuses on  to build and  to scale rather than day-to-day execution


 Deep experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud strategy, infrastructure, and Journey Builder.
 Significant experience in financial services or wealth management is highly preferred to credibly advise on industry-specific nuances and advisor-franchisee relationship models.
 Proven ability to communicate effectively with both non-technical business leaders and highly technical developers.
 10+ years of professional experience, with a track record of leading MarTech transformations in complex, regulated environments.

title: Senior Commercial Transformation Lead - B2B Sales Optimization - Microsoft ProServices Firm
description:
Problem Statement: We are a Microsoft technology consulting firm positioned for aggressive growth ($8M to $30M in 24 months), but our commercial maturity lags behind our delivery capability. We have successfully developed a proprietary, high-value methodology ("SPEAR") and have the internal tactical capacity to execute changes (CRM, Ops, Marketing). However, we lack the to transition our Go-to-Market motion from a "person-dependent" consultancy to a scalable "productized risk" engine. We have structural breaks in our sales logic, specifically in pricing strategy, organizational design ("Pods"), and the commercial narrative required to sell complex risk mitigation to the C-Suite. We need a high-level expert to design the commercial architecture that our team will build.

A validated, executive-grade Commercial Transformation Roadmap that bridges the gap between our current state and the $30M target. Success is defined by the delivery of a Commercial Architecture that:

Transforming our internal "Battle Cards" into a market-facing commercial strategy that forces C-level engagement.

A stress-tested organizational design (Engagement Lead + Practice Principal) that solves for velocity and scale, replacing our current friction-heavy handoffs.

A unified consensus among the CEO, CSO, and CMO on the exact "Rules of Engagement" required to scale, ensuring leadership stops "saving" deals and starts managing the system.

This is a engagement working directly with the C-Suite. The Expert is responsible for , while the internal team handles .


Conduct a "Voice of the Customer" and internal audit to diagnose exactly our velocity stalls, identifying the strategic disconnects between Sales, Delivery, and Finance.

Design the complete "Pod" operating model, defining the high-level Roles, Responsibilities, and economic incentives (Compensation Strategy) for the future "Hunter" roles.

Advise on the pricing structure and packaging of the "L3 Diagnostic" to ensure it functions as a high-velocity market wedge (Risk Insurance), rather than low-value consulting.

Shadow key leadership meetings and provide high-level coaching to the C-Suite on enforcing the new standards (e.g., "How to run a forecast call without accepting fluff").

Deliver the financial model and headcount "ramp plan" required to hit the 2-year target, identifying the exact "Trigger Points" for hiring.


CRM configuration, field mapping, or data entry.
Tactical pipeline scrubbing or day-to-day deal management.
Marketing collateral creation (graphic design/copywriting).


A comprehensive document outlining the "New Way of Selling," including the finalized Operating Model, Pricing Architecture, and Rules of Engagement.

A guide for leadership on how to manage the new engine (KPIs, Meeting Cadence, Coaching Frameworks).

A strategic assessment of current personnel and process vs. the $30M requirement.


Former Partner or Principal at a top-tier strategy firm (McKinsey, Bain, BCG, or Big 4 Strategy), or a former Chief Revenue Officer (CRO) of a professional services firm that scaled past $50M.


Proven ability to design sales organizations, not just manage them.
Deep understanding of the interplay between Utilization, Bookings, and Margin in a consulting environment.
Experience advising C-level executives on navigating cultural shifts during high-growth periods.
Must demonstrate the ability to stay at the "30,000-foot level" and direct the internal team on execution, rather than getting lost in the weeds.

title: Graphic Design & Copywriting – Women & Wealth Study (Phase 2)
description:
Project Overview: We are seeking a graphic designer and copywriter pair to support the marketing strategy and content development for the second phase of a data-driven "Women & Wealth" study. The study explores the financial behaviors, preferences, and unmet needs of high-earning women executives, with a target of over 10,000 respondents.


Design and copy for a comprehensive report based on the study's findings.
A high-impact presentation deck for sharing insights with industry stakeholders.
Adapting insights for differentiated offerings and thought leadership positioning across advisory and fintech circles.

Proven track record of producing best-in-class reports for top-tier firms (e.g., McKinsey, BCG, EY) or notable publications like the .
Ability to translate complex data into compelling narratives and visually engaging designs.

Expected within the next 1–2 weeks.
Targeting first two weeks of February 
Phase 2 will commence immediately upon onboarding as data becomes available.

title: Growth Strategy for Semiconductor AI Business Unit
description:
We are seeking a high-caliber Strategic Consultant & Operator to architect and execute our North American expansion. This is not an advisory role; we need a hands-on leader who has successfully scaled semiconductor AI businesses and can bridge the gap between high-level strategy and tactical market entry.

 Define our go-to-market (GTM) strategy to secure tier-one contracts with industry leaders and establish a permanent regional footprint.
Resolve sales bottlenecks by identifying and qualifying high-probability leads. You will lead both organic lead generation and the identification of strategic M&A targets to fast-track our technical capabilities.
Position our product as an end-to-end partner for , integrating hardware design, AI-led engineering, and specialized testing infrastructure.
Provide expert "operator-level" guidance

Director experience in the semiconductor AI space, preferably operator experience. 
Deep experience in growth strategy and M&A, with the ability to navigate complex high-value negotiations.
Direct experience within the Aerospace & Defense sector, including knowledge of compliance and specialized procurement cycles, is a bonus.

title: B2B Marketing Executive for PE-Backed Software Company
description:
We are a consulting firm working on an active comprehensive transformation program of all functions at a PE-backed B2B software company (~300m revenue). Our goal is to enhance operational efficiency/ scalability. We're going fucntion by funciotn making recommendations on workflow improvements, tool improvements, AI implementation, org restructuring initiatives.  
We are looking for a SME in marketing in a B2B software environment to lead this initiative in the marketing function. 

Key Elements of Workstream:
Developing a best cost location strategy for the marketing function
Tools / enablement recommendations to drive efficiency / effectiveness of marketing spend
Develop a framework of the best way to make use of agencies / data they purchased
Define go-forward marketing operating model
Through this, they should develop specific recommendations for the CMO and be a co-owner with the CMO to drive these initiatives.

Marketing org structure:
Product marketing
Marketing operations
Digital marketing
Industry marketing
This will need to be someone with in the space. Ideally this person also has experience working at companies, around .

title: Business Process Analysis/Architect
description:
Overview:
We are looking for a Business Process Architect (BPA) to support a critical service transformation initiative. The primary focus of this engagement is to bridge the gap between business discovery and technical architecture. You will join our upcoming workshops with the Service teams to capture, synthesize, and translate complex operational discussions into professional, scalable process diagrams.

The ideal consultant will have a deep understanding of the Technical Support and Field Service lifecycles and the ability to operate effectively within the CRM ecosystem.



Attend and facilitate technical discovery sessions with our Service stakeholders (starting mid-March).
Translate verbal requirements and "as-is" descriptions into detailed, high-fidelity process map.
Ensure all diagrams align with industry best practices for service operations and CRM integration.
:

Proven track record in Technical Support and Field Serviceworkflows (e.g., case management, dispatch, onsite service, parts logistics).
Mastery of process mapping tools and familiarity with CRM architecture
Ability to "read between the lines" during workshops to identify process gaps or inefficiencies.

title: Interim CMO for PE-backed Vertical Software Company
description:
The Company: PE-backed vertical software company ($100M–$500M revenue).
Seeking an Interim CMO "demand gen ninja" to provide fractional leadership and execution while we search for a permanent hire.
Full-time, 3-6 months
East coast-based preferred

title: Facilitate SIOP sales forecasting and demand planning kaizen event
description: Focusing on the "S" of SIOP, help two businesses design and implement methods for sales forecasting and demand planning.  The goal for this exercise is to achieve a consensus demand forecast that agrees with our ability to deliver the products, with commercial alignment, including daily / weekly / monthly standard work to maintain and utilize that forecast.  Novanta does have a playbook for this, but it has not yet been implemented at the businesses in question.

title: Interim GTM Lead: PBM Product Launch Strategy
description:
The Company: PE-backed pharmacy benefits optimizer (PBM).

We are seeking a GTM "growth architect" to lead the market introduction of a new, transparent PBM product. The focus is on rapid market penetration within the first 12 months, specifically targeting the broker and influencer ecosystem to drive new client acquisition.

Develop and deploy the tactical Year 1 growth playbook for a new transparent PBM offering.
Design a high-impact strategy to "stoke" the PBM broker market, leveraging existing relationships and creating incentives for market influencers.
Refine the value proposition for a transparent PBM model against traditional market players to maximize new logo wins.

Must have significant experience in the transparent PBM market (ideally from a high-growth background).
Proven track record of navigating and influencing the PBM broker/consultant landscape.
Experience taking a new healthcare or pharmacy product from $0 to significant Year 1 scale.

title: Interim GTM & Strategy Lead (Power Distribution & Data Center Tech)
description:
The Company: A PE-backed industrial technology firm specializing in high-performance power distribution solutions for the data center and critical infrastructure markets.

We are seeking a strategic GTM leader to help design and scale the commercial engine for a business at the forefront of data center innovation. This is a "design the machine" role, focused on creating the infrastructure for growth across both new logo acquisition and existing account expansion.


Audit and refine sales enablement, organizational design, and recruiting strategies to accelerate market penetration.
Develop the playbook for "farming" existing relationships while building a repeatable process for new client acquisition (Note: This is a strategy/enablement role, not direct selling).
Provide strategic input on next-generation product development, specifically involving the use of advanced materials (e.g., silicon carbide) in power distribution applications.
Opportunity to lead a pricing and cost-structure optimization project in ~2 months following a planned leadership transition.

Deep experience in GTM strategy for high-spec industrial or data center hardware.
Strong technical fluency, particularly with power electronics or specialized materials.
Proven track record in PE-backed environments, specifically building sales enablement and org structures from the ground up.

title: New Product Development: Silicon Carbide (SiC) & Power Engineering
description:
The Company: PE-backed data center infrastructure company.

We are seeking a Technical Subject Matter Expert (SME) to advise on the development of a next-generation product line. The focus is on leveraging to gain a competitive edge in the data center power distribution market. The ideal consultant will provide deep technical insight into the properties of this material and its practical applications in high-voltage infrastructure.


Evaluate the use of in data center power distribution applications.
Identify how can be leveraged to "get ahead of the market" in terms of efficiency, heat management, or footprint.
Advise the engineering team on the technical hurdles and advantages of integrating into existing power engineering capabilities.
Benchmark current industry developments to ensure the client’s product line is positioned as a market leader.

Deep technical background in Power Engineering and Materials Science.
Specific expertise in used in power electronics.
Experience applying these materials within the Data Center or Critical Infrastructure space.

title: Loss Prevention Merchandising Solution Engagement
description:
Overview:
We're looking for a consultant who has experience in the retail loss prevention space to help us evaluate two products we have launching this year, providing pros and cons, and suggesting improvements.


Evaluating the solutions, identifying competitors, and suggesting adjustments for success. Providing guidance on how to sell the solutions into the marketplace, as the current sales team sells on-shelf merchandising solutions and lacks loss prevention expertise.
The ability to make introductions to potential industry peers, customers, etc. :
Retail loss prevention experience.
Experience at Target, Walmart, CVS, and grocery stores such as Kroger, Albertsons, and Publix is strongly preferred.

title: AWS Data Lake Sprint
description:
AWS Data Lake Sprint – Statement of Work
Project Overview
Client: Broadband Company
Location: New England-based operations; Boston-area consultants preferred but not required
Engagement Type: Contract consultant, immediate availability required
Budget: $200–$250/hour
Duration: 4-6 weeks, with potential for extension
Start Date: Immediately (February 2026)
Business Context
This Broadband Company operates a network portfolio serving commercial and residential customers across fiber, copper, and contracted operations. The business is in the midst of critical strategic decisions requiring immediate access to reliable unit economics, customer profitability analysis, and operational intelligence.
An AWS data lake project was initiated to centralize and analyze financial, billing, and customer data from multiple legacy systems (BillingSystemA billing, CRMSysB, AcctSysC accounting, Vendor circuit inventory, NetworkSysE network planning, HRSysD, FutureSysG future billing). The project has made substantial technical progress but has stalled due to:
Underestimated data quality issues in legacy systems
Scope expansion as business needs became clearer
Internal resource constraints – staff pulled to operational firefighting
Timeline slippage – deadlines have repeatedly moved due to the above and complexity
The infrastructure is largely in place: S3 buckets configured, Glue catalogs created, Athena queries functional, raw and curated data layers partially populated, and a PrototypeUIF prototype UI built. What's needed is a senior AWS and AI data/analytics consultant to help push the project across the finish line by validating data, completing integrations, training the AI layer, and delivering a production-ready dashboard with accurate, complete data.
Current State Assessment: What's Built and Working
Infrastructure (Complete):
AWS S3 data lake (raw and curated buckets in us-east-2)
AWS Glue data catalog with crawlers
Amazon Athena for SQL queries
PrototypeUIF prototype UI with natural language query interface
IAM roles, encryption (server-side), CloudWatch/CloudTrail logging (basic)
Data Ingestion (Partially Complete):
BillingSystemA (billing): Test exports loaded, schema mapped, invoice line-item reproduction views (v1) working, nightly exports designed but blocked by DNS configuration
CRMSysB: Full org export completed (Accounts, Contracts, Opportunities), not yet landed in S3/Athena, attachments/files export pending
AcctSysC: Trial balance and AP/AR aging reports pulled, partial ingestion (vendor/customer/AP healthy; GL ENTRY failing)
Vendor Circuit Inventory: Spreadsheet data loaded, margin band views (A-E classification) complete, fully-loaded margin model v1.1 in progress
NetworkSysE: FSA (fiber service area) polygons loaded, premise/BSL-level features NOT landed
Curated Views (Partially Complete):
Customer dimension table (dimcustomerBillingSystemA) – thousands of unique customers identified
Monthly MRR/churn summary (vmonthlymrrandchurnsummary) – working for FY2025
Vendor margin bands (A-E) – complete v1, three action shortlists created
Hosted PBX migration economics – complete v1
Invoice line-item reproduction – complete for 3-month window
System segmentation (Network A vs Network B vs Network C) – partially wired
3-bucket customer classification (Customer Type) – logic defined, wiring in progress
Dashboard (Prototype in PrototypeUIF):
Natural language query interface (text-to-SQL via AWS AI Layer)
Tiles for MRR, active customers, churn, A-E margin bands, Hosted PBX uplift
Evidence panels showing SQL queries and Athena execution IDs
CSV export functionality
Some tiles reconciled; others still need validation
What's Incomplete or Blocked
Critical Blockers (as of January 29, 2026):
CRMSysB-BillingSystemA crosswalk table not populated → Customer Type bucket split cannot map system-effective IDs to human-readable keys like "LOCATION 1" or "LOCATION 2"
AcctSysC December 2025 GL Detail not landed → Existing GL data (Oct 2025) mis-shaped (col1..col10 format unusable for EBITDA calculations)
NetworkSysE premise/BSL feature export not landed → Premises-passed/served KPIs cannot be lake-backed; BSL counts per system unavailable
BillingSystemA SQL nightly export connectivity issue → Worker cannot resolve hostname due to DNS misconfiguration (no upstream resolver, no sudo access to fix /etc/resolv.conf); workaround is to use DB IP directly or fix DNS search domain
AcctSysC GL ENTRY ingestion failing → Daily ingest healthy for vendors/customers/AP but GL ENTRY returns "status=failure, processing error"; workaround is querying historical partitions
Security hardening incomplete → IAM roles slightly over-granted (intentional for dev speed), no formal least-privilege roles defined for CEO/finance/sales, no dedicated KMS CMK with tagging standards, no formal security review/sign-off
Contract PDFs not centralized → CRMSysB attachment exports not completed; contract PDFs not gathered into shared location; prevents "Customer 360" contract term analysis
Data quality validation incomplete → Known disputes in certain circuit data (flagged by operations lead), orphan costs/revenues (circuits/accounts that don't cleanly map between BillingSystemA/circuit/CRMSysB), COGS accuracy not signed off as audit-ready
Functional Gaps:
Period toggles (Current/YTD/Monthly) in dashboard only partially functional – monthly-capable views exist, but current-only views don't support time-series yet
AI layer (Amazon Bedrock + Q Business) designed but not implemented – natural language interface prototype uses PrototypeUIF, not production AWS stack
Automated nightly refresh – designed but not fully operational due to BillingSystemA SQL connectivity blocker
GL Close Pack tile – month-aware revenue close views defined but not wired to dashboard
Movement/churn views by segment and system/project – partially built, not reconciled to core MRR spine
Fully-loaded margin (COGS + OPEX allocation) – COGS v1 complete, OPEX allocation method not finalized, AcctSysC GL wiring incomplete
Executive P&L by bucket/segment – designed but not delivered (requires complete OPEX + margin views)
Projects pipeline module in Dashboard – schema defined, S3 change-file pattern designed, ETL not implemented
FutureSysG migration prep – customer/product tagging in progress, lake export contracts not finalized
Scope of Work – Deliverables
The consultant will complete the following in priority order:
Phase 1: Critical Path to Production (Week 1-2)
1.1 Resolve Technical Blockers
Fix BillingSystemA SQL nightly export connectivity (coordinate with IT to resolve DNS or configure DB IP workaround)
Resolve AcctSysC GL ENTRY ingestion failure (debug Lambda/Glue error, implement fix or workaround)
Populate CRMSysB-BillingSystemA crosswalk table (curatedcore.sfsystemscrosswalk) to enable bucket mapping
Land CRMSysB Accounts/Contracts/Opportunities CSVs in S3/Athena (already extracted, need loading)
Land AcctSysC December 2025 GL Detail in correct schema (replace mis-shaped Oct 2025 data)
Coordinate NetworkSysE premise/BSL feature export and land in lake (work with NetworkSysE vendor/internal GIS contact)
1.2 Complete Core Curated Views
Finalize 3-bucket customer classification (Owned FTTP / Contracted FTTP / CLEC Business) with system-to-bucket mapping fully wired
Complete monthly MRR movement/churn views by segment and system/project, reconciled to core MRR spine
Wire AcctSysC GL OPEX allocation views (define v1 allocation method with finance, implement in curated layer)
Deliver fully-loaded margin views (COGS + OPEX) at customer level, usable for executive P&L
Complete Executive P&L by Bucket/Segment view (revenue, COGS, OPEX, operating margin with 6-12 month trend)
1.3 Data Quality Validation
Audit and document known data quality issues (vendor invoices, orphan costs/revenues, mapping gaps)
Implement data quality checks in curated views (flag anomalies, missing mappings, out-of-range values)
Work with operations lead to sign off on COGS accuracy baseline or document acceptable tolerance
Create "proof pack" queries for key metrics (customer count, MRR, margin bands, churn) with evidence trails
1.4 Automated Refresh Implementation
Implement nightly/scheduled refresh for BillingSystemA billing data (once connectivity fixed)
Implement scheduled refresh for CRMSysB, AcctSysC, Vendors, NetworkSysE feeds (daily or weekly as appropriate)
Configure AWS Glue crawlers to run on schedule and update catalog
Implement monitoring/alerting for failed ingestion jobs (CloudWatch alarms, SNS notifications)
Phase 2: Dashboard Production Readiness (Week 2-3)
2.1 Validate and Complete Dashboard Tiles
Validate all existing tiles against source data (MRR, active customers, churn, A-E bands, Hosted PBX)
Implement period toggles (Current/YTD/Monthly) with correct view routing logic
Add missing tiles per feature inventory: GL Close Pack (month-aware), Movement/Churn by Segment, Executive P&L by Bucket
Reconcile tile outputs to canonical lake views (ensure one source of truth)
Document acceptance test queries for each tile (SQL proof packs)
2.2 Natural Language Query Interface
Review PrototypeUIF prototype and document functional requirements for production AWS implementation
Recommend approach: Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Base + Amazon Q Business vs. custom Lambda/API Gateway + LLM integration
If time permits in Phase 2, begin AWS-native implementation; otherwise, document detailed implementation plan
Ensure natural language queries route to same curated views as dashboard tiles (consistent data)
2.3 Evidence and Audit Trail
Ensure every dashboard tile and AI query response includes evidence panel: Athena query execution ID, generated SQL, row count, timestamp
Implement fail-closed error handling (no fabricated data if Athena fails; clear error messages)
Document discoverable queries (SHOW COLUMNS, DESCRIBE checks before complex SELECTs)
Phase 3: Security Hardening and Production Handoff (Week 3-4)
3.1 Security Review and Implementation
Conduct formal security review with IT leadership
Define least-privilege IAM roles for: Executive (CEO), Finance team, Sales team, Read-only analysts, CTO/admin
Implement dedicated KMS CMK for S3/Glue/Athena encryption with proper tagging standards
Configure CloudTrail and CloudWatch logging with appropriate retention policies
Implement S3 bucket policies, VPC endpoints (if needed), and network security groups
Document security controls in compliance-ready format (encryption at rest/in transit, access control matrix, audit logging)
3.2 Contract Document Integration
Work with business teams to centralize contract PDFs and CRMSysB attachments in designated Google Drive folder
Implement automated S3 sync from Google Drive to S3 knowledge bucket
Extract key contract terms (pricing, renewal dates, SLAs, price caps) into structured curated view (if time permits; otherwise document approach)
Enable "Customer 360 – Customer A" view: contract terms + current ARPU + product tiers (answer: can we raise prices? what's contractual?)
3.3 Documentation and Knowledge Transfer
Create comprehensive data dictionary: all source systems, raw tables, curated views, column definitions, join keys
Document data lineage and transformation logic (raw → curated layer)
Document dashboard: tile definitions, underlying views, acceptance test queries, period toggle behavior
Create runbook for common operational tasks: refresh schedules, monitoring dashboards, troubleshooting failed jobs, adding new data sources
Conduct knowledge transfer sessions with internal team (CEO, CTO, finance, operations leads)
Create end-user guide for dashboard: how to interpret tiles, run natural language queries, export data, understand evidence panels
Phase 4: Extended Features (Week 4-6, if time/budget permits)
4.1 AI Layer Production Implementation
Deploy Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Base with S3 indexing (curated views + contract PDFs)
Deploy Amazon Q Business chat interface with connectors to S3/Glue/Athena
Configure IAM-based access control (CEO access first, expandable to team)
Integrate QuickSight with Q for "type-to-chart" dashboard generation
Test natural language query accuracy against acceptance test cases
Document usage patterns and best practices for business users
4.2 Advanced Analytics Views
Implement Projects Pipeline module (S3 change-file pattern, ETL, curatedcore.projectsenriched table, Dashboard UI integration)
Implement customer-level drill-down views (margin, churn, product mix, support tickets, distance from office)
Implement NetworkSysE BSL rollups by FSA and bucket (premises passed/served, revenue per BSL)
Implement lockbox cash application matching (if requirements finalized by finance team)
Implement change-file driven update pattern for BillingSystemA/CRMSysB (AWS change log, versioned S3 files, Athena log table)
4.3 Future System Integration Prep
Document FutureSysG migration export contracts (field mappings, validation checks, data enrichment requirements)
Document HRSysD data integration approach (if payroll/labor allocation needed for OPEX attribution)
Recommend approach for Calix network monitoring integration (if operational telemetry needed)
Deliverables Summary
Week 1-2: Critical Path
✅ All technical blockers resolved (DNS, AcctSysC, CRMSysB crosswalk, AcctSysC GL, NetworkSysE BSL)
✅ Core curated views complete (3-bucket model, movement/churn, OPEX, fully-loaded margin, executive P&L)
✅ Data quality audit report with signed-off baseline
✅ Automated nightly refresh operational with monitoring
Week 2-3: Dashboard Production
✅ All dashboard tiles validated and reconciled
✅ Period toggles (Current/YTD/Monthly) functional
✅ Natural language query interface validated (PrototypeUIF) or AWS-native implementation begun
✅ Evidence panels and audit trails complete
Week 3-4: Security & Handoff
✅ Security review complete, least-privilege IAM roles implemented
✅ KMS CMK, CloudTrail, CloudWatch configured per best practices
✅ Contract documents centralized and integrated (Customer 360 view functional)
✅ Comprehensive documentation suite (data dictionary, lineage, runbooks, user guides)
✅ Knowledge transfer sessions completed
Week 4-6: Extended Features (if applicable)
✅ Amazon Bedrock + Q Business production deployment
✅ Advanced analytics views (Projects, BSL rollups, drill-downs, lockbox, change-log)
✅ Future system integration documentation (FutureSysG, HRSysD, Calix)
Required Consultant Qualifications
Must-Have Technical Skills
AWS Data Lake Expertise: Deep hands-on experience with S3, Glue (crawlers, ETL, Data Catalog), Athena, Lake Formation
SQL Mastery: Complex query authoring, view design, performance optimization, data modeling
Data Integration: ETL/ELT patterns, incremental refresh strategies, schema evolution handling
AWS AI/ML Services: Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock, Q Business, QuickSight, or equivalent generative AI tooling
Data Quality & Governance: Data profiling, validation logic, lineage documentation, audit trail implementation
AWS Security: IAM role/policy design, KMS encryption, VPC configuration, CloudTrail/CloudWatch, compliance frameworks
Preferred Skills
BI/Dashboard Tools: Amazon QuickSight or Tableau/Looker/Power BI experience
Telecommunications/Broadband Domain: Understanding of billing systems, customer lifecycle, MRR/churn metrics, unit economics
Legacy System Integration: Experience wrangling messy data from aging billing systems, CRMs, accounting platforms
Natural Language Query Interfaces: Experience building RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) applications over structured data
Python/Lambda: For custom transformations, API integrations, automation scripts
Google Drive/Apps Script Integration: For file ingestion workflows
Soft Skills (Critical)
Executive Communication: Ability to translate technical status into business impact for CEO and leadership team
Pragmatic Problem-Solving: Focus on "good enough for production" vs. endless perfection; bias toward shipping
Independent Execution: Self-directed work with minimal supervision; proactive issue identification
Stakeholder Management: Comfort navigating organizational politics, gathering requirements from non-technical users, resolving data disputes between teams
Documentation Discipline: Clear, concise technical writing for handoff to internal teams
Engagement Logistics
Work Arrangement
Remote work acceptable with reliable communication (Slack/email, video calls)
Boston-area preferred but not required (potential for 1-2 onsite visits if local)
Availability: Immediate start required; must be able to commit 30-40 hours/week for 4-6 weeks
Collaboration: Daily standup check-ins (15 min), weekly progress reviews with CEO/CTO
Tools and Access
Consultant will be provided:
AWS account access (IAM credentials with appropriate permissions)
Slack workspace access for team communication
Google Drive access for documentation and file sharing
Zoom/Google Meet for video calls
Athena query console, PrototypeUIF prototype credentials, relevant documentation
Key Contacts
(CEO): Business requirements, strategic priorities, final approvals
(CTO / Current Project Lead): Technical handoff, system architecture, AWS infrastructure
(IT/Security Lead): Security review, IAM configuration, network access
(Operations Lead): Data quality validation (Vendor, circuit inventory, COGS sign-off)
(Finance Lead): AcctSysC, GL detail, OPEX allocation requirements
(Sales/Ops Lead): CRMSysB data, support workflows, customer segmentation
Success Criteria
Phase 1 Success (Week 1-2)
All data feeds flowing automatically on schedule (BillingSystemA, CRMSysB, AcctSysC, Vendor, NetworkSysE)
Zero technical blockers preventing query execution
Core curated views return consistent, defensible numbers for customer count, MRR, margin
CEO can run acceptance test queries in Athena and get same results as spreadsheets
Phase 2 Success (Week 2-3)
Dashboard tiles reconciled to single source of truth (no conflicting numbers)
Period toggles work correctly (Current/YTD/Monthly with proper view routing)
Natural language queries return accurate results grounded in curated views
CEO can ask "How many customers in E-band?" and get instant, correct answer with evidence
Phase 3 Success (Week 3-4)
Security review signed off by IT leadership
Least-privilege IAM roles deployed (CEO can access, unauthorized users blocked)
Contract documents centralized; certain Customer 360 view answers pricing questions
Internal team can run nightly refresh, troubleshoot failures, add new data sources independently
Overall Project Success
CEO self-sufficiency: Can query customer profitability, unit economics, margin bands without CTO/consultant help
Operational reliability: Data refreshes nightly without manual intervention; monitoring alerts on failures
Defensible numbers: All KPIs backed by documented SQL queries, reconciled to source systems, audit-ready
Production readiness: System can support board presentations, investor diligence, strategic decision-making with confidence
Budget and Timeline
Hourly Rate: $200–$250/hour (negotiable based on experience and qualifications)
Estimated Hours: 120-200 hours over 4-6 weeks (30-40 hours/week)
Total Budget Range: $24,000 - $50,000
Payment Terms: Net 15, invoiced weekly or bi-weekly
Extension Option: Additional hours available if extended features (Phase 4) prove valuable
Urgency and Context
This engagement is urgent. Strategic decisions on pricing, customer retention, network investment, and headcount require immediate access to reliable unit economics. The data lake infrastructure is 70-80% complete; what's needed is an experienced finisher who can debug blockers, validate data, and deliver production-ready analytics within 2-4 weeks, not 2-4 months.
The ideal consultant:
Has "seen this movie before" (messy telecom billing data, legacy system integration, AWS data lake rescue projects)
Can hit the ground running with minimal handholding
Knows when to say "good enough" and ship vs. over-engineer
Can translate data quality issues into business risk language for executives
Delivers working software, not PowerPoint architecture
If you have the skills and availability to complete this critical project immediately, we want to hear from you.
How to Respond
Please submit via Catalant platform:
Brief introduction (2-3 paragraphs): Relevant AWS data lake experience, telecommunications/SaaS analytics background, similar rescue projects completed
Availability: Confirm immediate availability and hours/week commitment for 4-6 weeks
Hourly rate: Within $200-$250 range
Location: Boston-area or fully remote
Three references: Prior clients for AWS data lake / BI / analytics projects
Sample deliverables (if available): Data dictionary, runbook, or dashboard documentation from prior engagements
Priority will be given to consultants who can start within 48-72 hours.
Questions?
For clarification on project scope, technical details, or engagement logistics, please message via Catalant platform. Responses within 24 hours for qualified candidates.
